Events that occurred on 29 November.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1898 - Author C.S. Lewis is born.
1937 - Jared Lobdell is born.
1916 - G.B. Smith is hit by shrapnel, and wounded on his right arm and thigh.
1943 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 52.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 91.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 91a.
1955 - The third episode of 1955 radio series of The Fellowship of the Ring airs on the BBC Third Programme.
1971 â€“ Edith Tolkien dies after a short but severe illness attributed to an inflamed gall-bladder.
1971 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 331.
2001 - Quest for the Ring airs on FOX TV.
2002 - Actor John Justin dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
